justification: “Each participant … indicated to their friends their endorsement of visiting that restaurant using a slider with responses ranging between 0 (Definitely not) to 100 (Enthusiastic).”
construct: Willingness to dine at the restaurant

measured_by: SIG recall question (indicator of correct recall)
justification: “Participants … answered recall questions about the restaurant. One question checked participants' recall of the SIG (or its absence).”

measured_by: Coding of open-ended response for SIG mention
justification: “We examined … the degree to which participants reported using the SIG information (coded as 1 whenever the SIG was mentioned) in deciding on their likelihood of dining.”
construct: Use of SIG information in decision

measured_by: −100 to 100 slider scale (extremely unlikely to extremely likely)
justification: “This likelihood was elicited using a slider [-100, 100] with seven labels ranging from extremely unlikely to extremely likely.”
construct: Likelihood of hiring the service provider

measured_by: Customer-reference recall question (indicator of correct recall)
justification: “Participants who listened to the GA conversation … were much more likely to correctly recall its availability.”

measured_by: Coding of open-ended response for ‘reference’ mention
justification: “Participants who interacted with one of the GA stimuli were also more likely to mention the term ‘reference’ in the open response question than participants who interacted with a screenshot stimulus.”
construct: Use of customer reference in decision reasoning
